<h1>Scenic Himachal Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/himachal-tour-packages" title="Himachal Tour Packages">Himachal Pradesh</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Scenic Himachal Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c2fce9eecf6_42998311" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">

<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/scenic-himachal.jpg" alt="Scenic Himachal Tour Package" title="Scenic Himachal Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>From enormous expanses of high-altitude Trans-Himalayan desert to lush, green deodar woods, apple orchards to terraced terraces, snow-capped high Himalayan mountain ranges to snow-fed lakes and flowing rivers. A true joy for nature lovers is Himachal. This 9 days / 8 nights tour would be taking you along through the best hill stations and cities in the region and nearby. So just book yourself and your loved ones to this exciting journey of your life.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Scenic Himachal Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Shimla</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>You arrive in Delhi to be greeted by our Namaste India Trip representative who then takes you to the waiting comfortable coach that will take you to Shimla, the lovely hill resort and the one-time summer capital of India during the times of the British. You arrive late in the evening, refresh yourself, go for a little walk and spend the night in your hotel room.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Shimla Sightseeing and Kufri</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Breakfast over you set out to drink in the charms of this seductive hill resort so beloved of the British. Your tour starts with a visit to the Kalbadevi temple and then you go on to the famous Jakhu temple. Next in line is a visit to the popular Hanuman Temple. Shimla’s Christ Church is typical British architecture dating back to the 1850s. It is the stained glass windows of this church that will hold your attention. It is time for lunch and then an excursion to nearby Kufri, a lovely and enchanting hill resort set amid forests and snow-capped mountains. Walk and take in the attractions of Fagu, the Indira Gandhi Holiday Home and enjoy a ride on a horse. You return by evening and take a stroll along the Mall.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Shimla – Kullu – Manali – 149 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today is another hectic day as your morning starts with a drive to Manali. You and the group stop at Kullu valley and take in the beautiful scenery and proceed to Manali. The captivating charm of Kullu valley never fails to entrance visitors as you will find when you visit Dussehra and go on to Kulantapitha, a remote yet inhabited little hamlet that is as old as time itself. Your ride takes you through the scenic valley spread over 80 km with mountains on either side covered by lush forests of deodar and murmuring streams gamboling along playfully.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Manali – Rohtang Pass</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today is a day to explore the Rohtang Pass, one of the highest motorable passes in the world. From high above you get an eagle’s eye view of the land spread around you and your trip here takes you to Snow Point and then on to Solang Valley. Solang is known as a skiing destination where people also enjoy paragliding and other sports such as scooter rides and horse rides. Tired, exhilarated and fulfilled you return to your hotel in Manali for a well-earned rest.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Manali – Dharamsala 240 Km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>An early morning breakfast and then you board the coach for the drive to Dharamsala. Dharamsala is mini Tibet and the entire place is imbued with Buddhist culture. You will visit the monastery and then walk along the streets with a chance to buy handicrafts, carpets and some souvenirs to remind you of your visit. You could also try herbal remedies available here and then retire for the night in your hotel here.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Dharamsala – Dalhousie 127 km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>We are not done with Dharamsala as you go on to McLeodganj, a charming little town. This is the residence of the Dalai Lama and you get to visit his residence and stroll through the winding streets after which it is time to go on to Dalhousie, one of the loveliest hill resorts of Himachal with overtones of colonial life still existing here. Stay the night in your hotel in Dalhousie.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Dalhousie Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>A lovely golden dawn greets you and a healthy breakfast a waits. Finish with it and off you go to explore this charming colonial retreat and all its attractions. Your trip here takes you to Khajjiar, Chamba, Panchpula, Subhash Baoli and Kalatop. You also visit the Satdhara Falls and Jandri Ghat, two places of ineffable natural beauty. After that you return to main town of Dalhousie and explore central Park and have a dekko in the Church. The excursion done with, you return to your hotel room for the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Dalhousie – Amritsar</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>You arrive in Amritsar and go on to visit the world famous Golden Temple where hundreds of Sikhs arrive for pilgrimage and also for daily prayers. Take a look at the prayer hall and the place where food is cooked for visitors. After that the group goes on to Jallianwala Baugh to pay respects to the martyrs of the Indian revolution. With some time left in the evening, you explore streets, shop a little, dine on local treats and retire for the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Chandigarh – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Visit the planned city of Chandigarh with thousands of flowers, the Sukhna Lake and Rock garden. Time permitting you could visit the Museum or the Art Gallery. Though you cannot spend much time here, you will find the visit memorable before you go on to board the coach to return to Delhi where your tour ends.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Scenic Himachal Tour Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> How Would You Describe The Scenic Beauty Of Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The mountain ranges in this region reach heights of 7000 metres above sea level. The tranquil blue valleys and lovely streams surround the snow-covered mountains. For those who enjoy the outdoors, the location is perfect because there are beautiful views around every bend. The state brilliantly displays the unadulterated beauty of nature.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Special Attraction Of Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Richard La. Rohtang La, commonly referred to as Rohtang Pass, lies tucked away at the astounding elevation of 3,978 metres above sea level. Chandratal Lake, Hadimba Devi Temple, and the Great Himalayan National Park.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Favourite Sweet Of Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Meetha Chawal is the favourite sweet of Himachal. It is made for festivals and special events and is regarded as the traditional sweet dish of the region.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Dances Are Famous In Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rakshasa the devil dance, Kayang, Bakayang, the Bnayangchu, the Jataru Kayang, Chohara, Shand and Shabu, Lang-dar-ma, Nati, Jhanjhar, Jhoor, Gi and Rasa are the most well-known dances in the state.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Famous Festival In Himachal Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The most well-known festival in Himachal Pradesh is Kullu Dussehra, which is enthusiastically observed in the month of October. The celebration of Dussehra in Dhaulpur Maidan causes the entire Kullu valley to vibrate with celebration for a full week. In this location, the holiday can last up to seven long days.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

A true joy for nature lovers is Himachal. This 9...
